intro: Jurinea kemahensis, commonly known as the Kemah sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure adapted to harsh desert conditions. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Jurinea kemahensis is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to environments with limited rainfall.
